title: 114_hr1317
content: SECTION 1. TREATMENT OF AFFILIATE TRANSACTIONS. Commodity Exchange Act Amendments: Section 2(h)(7)(D) is amended to specify that an affiliate of a person qualifying for an exception must enter into a swap to hedge or mitigate commercial risk. The amendment specifies that an affiliate must enter into a swap to hedge or mitigate commercial risk, provided the affiliate meets certain ownership criteria. The amendment allows an entity to engage in swaps to hedge commercial risk, with restrictions on providing services to nonbank financial company affiliates. Entities eligible to engage in swaps include a major security-based swap participant, commodity pool, bank holding company, private fund, employee benefit plan, government plan, insured depository institution. Entities eligible to engage in swaps include a variety of institutions such as a farm credit system, credit union, nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors, and entities engaged in the business of insurance subject to capital requirements established by an insurance governmental authority. Entities eligible to engage in swaps include institutions like a farm credit system, credit union, nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors, and insurance businesses subject to capital requirements set by an insurance governmental authority. The exception for engaging in swaps does not apply to affiliates affiliated with major security-based swap participants or security-based swap entities in countries other than the United States. Entities eligible to engage in swaps include institutions like a farm credit system, credit union, nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors, and insurance businesses subject to capital requirements set by an insurance governmental authority. The exception for engaging in swaps does not apply to affiliates affiliated with major security-based swap participants or security-based swap entities in countries other than the United States. Affiliates qualifying for the exception may only enter swaps for hedging or mitigating commercial risk, and non-financial entities affiliated with them are restricted from entering swaps with or on behalf of the affiliate. Entities eligible to engage in swaps may enter into swaps with or on behalf of affiliates that are financial entities, except those affiliated with major security-based swap participants or entities in foreign countries. Affiliates qualifying for the exception can only enter swaps for hedging or mitigating commercial risk and must have a centralized risk management program in place for any swaps entered into. An affiliate must have a centralized risk management program to qualify for an exception under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The exception applies if the affiliate hedges commercial risk for a non-financial entity, is wholly-owned by a qualified affiliate or non-financial entity, not majority-owned by a financial entity, and not ultimately owned by a financial entity. The exception to the rule applies if the affiliate hedges commercial risk for a non-financial entity, is wholly-owned by a qualified affiliate or non-financial entity, and does not provide services to nonbank financial companies supervised by the Board of Governors. The exception does not apply if the affiliate is a swap dealer, security-based swap dealer, major swap participant, major security-based swap participant, commodity pool, or bank holding company. The entities exempt from certain regulations include a bank holding company, private fund, employee benefit plan, government plan, insured depository institution, farm credit system institution, credit union, and nonbank financial company supervised by the Board of Governors. Entities exempt from certain regulations include insurance entities subject to capital requirements established by insurance governmental authorities of various jurisdictions. The exception may not apply to affiliates' affiliates unless determined by the Commission to be in the public interest. The exception in subparagraph (A) does not apply to an affiliate affiliated with major security-based swap participants, security-based swap dealers, major swap participants, or swap dealers. Conditions on transactions for qualifying affiliates include only entering into security-based swaps for hedging or mitigating commercial risk. The exception in subparagraph (A) does not apply to affiliates affiliated with certain entities. Affiliates that qualify for the exception must have a centralized risk management program for security-based swaps. The affiliate must have a centralized risk management program for security-based swaps to monitor and manage risks associated with the swaps and identify affiliates involved. The House of Representatives passed the bill on November 16, 2015. Karen L. Haas is the Clerk.
